case.title: Reports: TRX-2498 - Allocation Models - Class report showing incorrect tolerances (keep if ModelMaintenance tests are done)

step.content: Log into demo database as TrxAutomation

step.expected: Class view for the model will appear

step.content: Change COMM to tolerance of 5%, GFI to tolerance of 15%, GE to tolerance of 22% and Save Changes
Click on Allocation Model Class Data Export report and download

step.expected: Confirm that the tolerance for model 2014 - 50/50 have been adjusted to 5% for COMM, 15% for FI, and 22% for GE while the others remain at 20%

case.title: Verify Security Selection bug is fixed

custom.description: see TRX-2521. Automated test will verify this is fixed.

Log in Wait for the release notes modal Verify the version number in the modal against the input version number The version number will be in either a command line parameter or environment variable Verify the contents of the dashboard The purpose of the smoke test is to prevent wasting time running other tests if the product is not runnable.

step.content: enter username and password on login screen
verify TRX version in Release Notes modal
step.expected: version number is an input parameter which varies

custom.steps:
- Settings -> Enterprise -> Trading Options -> Select Fix Flyer -> edit user password (trading@xyzfirm/test) -> validate
Direct Trades with FF: - create trade proposal - process to trades stage - click direct trades - select FF, password is test - submit
to generate trade files for fix flyer - Settings -> Enterprise -> Enrollment Fix Flyer -> enter any user/password, click link to see agreement, click agree box, Save - Settings -> Enterprise -> Custodians -> select custodian for the client you are generating trades for -> select TDAmeritrade fmt - Do a rebalance for that client, on Trades stage of workflow, click Direct Trades button - Select Fix Flyer enrollment, click Download in the FIX column, look at the csv file

Help -> Contact Support Verify contents of modal by form, not exact:
Morningstar Total Rebalance Expert U.S. Product Support: (619) 294-4879 Monday-Friday 8am - 6pm Central Time TRXMorningstarProductSupport@morningstar.com
Help -> Give Feedback Verify contents: Give Feedback Tell us more here... Send button will only work in PROD, so do not try to send unless environment is PROD
Help -> User Guide Verify that a new tab opens and has URL trx*.Morningstar.com/TRXUserGuide.pdf

Allen, Phillip and Irma Account 9999-0007 . click trade options, manual trade, create proposal, review, select account Do edits buy ACBPX, sell AIANX $1200 each

History is somehow related to the import process, but this needs further research before a test can be designed. I am putting this case in "Marked as deleted" until I know how to design it.
Start a rebalance, check History -> LVL1 Review, check History -> Trades, check History -> Dismiss, check history -> Cancel, check history
Client Katz, Jeffery Personal Portfolio Manage Settings -> Buy Set = buyset1 rebalance, verify trade files
Client Management -> Securities Change ADFIX to must sell Rebalance Katz, Jeffery Personal Portfolio, verify trades files

Accounts screen -> Assign Clients Select New Client option, assign two accounts from existing clients. Wait for Recalculating to finish. Update the new client's advisor set (client page->manage settings). Verify Client page and accounts for new client Verify account is gone from old clients (look up account # on accounts list)

Accounts screen -> Assign Clients Change Client option, assign two accounts from existing clients. Wait for Recalculating to finish. Verify Client page and accounts for new client Verify account is gone from old clients and is added to new clients and that all client data reflects the addition and removal of the accounts (client page, positions, trade overrides, accounts)
Settings -> Data Maintenance Select Household Download, verify
Settings -> Data maintenance Select Allocation Model Download, verify

select client by id 8201, which, by default would sell DFREX go to client page click trading overrides filter for DFREX by symbol click on DFREX -> trading overrides modal select Do Not Sell from Sell Setting, click Add Override, exit
rebalance client 8201 verify trades do not include DFREX

Client Management -> Securities -> Add Security The following has already been built into the default.bak DB backup: Create new security with type = equivalency called EQUIVBUY and set "counts as" to INTLSC Go to Security page -> Equivalency Allocations -> add securities with allocations (ACINX 10%, AIOIX 20%, FISMX 70%) Create a new buy set (call it equiv), copied from standard buy set. Modify preferred buys for INTLSC so the subclass has EQUIVBUY for account types IRA, ROTH, TAX. Leave TLHA as is because TAX and TLHA cannot have same security in a buy set. Client: Garner, Wayne, change buyset to equiv
The test is just to run rebalance for Garner, Wayne and verify trade files

Settings->Enterprise->Custodians
Set Redemption Fee cost approach = always, penalty percent = 5% for SCHWAB, 10% for BAA Set redemption fee global settings->trade settings, Allow Redemption Fees less than $ = 100,000, Transaction Cost % = 100 so as to not prevent trades which have redemption fees.
Rebalance Katz, Jeffery. He has accounts which have BAA custodian and accounts with SCHWAB as custodian. verify Trade Proposal screen -> View Summary and Trading Constraints show redemption fees verify Trade files

case.title: Redemption fee set on individual securities

Client Management->Securities Set redemption fee 1% on securities FDRXX and PFODX Set Global Settings->Trade Settings-> Allow Redemption Fees less than $ 2000, max transaction cost 2%

Client Management->Securities Set redemption fee 1% on security FDRXX and PFODX Set Global Settings->Trade Settings red fee limit $50, 2% Rebalance Zeller Personal Portfolio (FDRXX does not trade, PFODX trade is reduced)

case.title: Redemption fee "Interval" policy one day over the limit

custom.steps:
Settings->Enterprise->Custodians Select Schwab, set Redemption Fee cost approach = interval, days=30, penalty percent = 4%, save With SQL script, set original trade dates for DFREX lots to today-31 to trigger redemption fee policy (one day over the limit) update [TRX_TRX_0000_QATEMPLATE].[dbo].[ExpTradeLot] set tradedate='<current date>', OriginalTradeDate='<current date - 31 days>' where symbol='DFREX' and PortfolioDescription like 'Allen, Philip & Irma%'
Rebalance client 8187 (Allen, Philip & Irma) to Review stage, then verify Summary modal has correct redemption fee
custom.preconds: restore db from default.bak and do SQL script mentioned above

custom.steps: Intraday Pricing global-settings/trade-settings Intraday Pricing is off in default.bak Client Management->Securities Look up AMZN, it will show no price because TRX DB has no price for it.

case.title: Tactical Trader Make multiple tactical trades, accumulate them in the same blotter

custom.description:
[ new TacticalTrade( //4 trades new Filter('CFI', 'VBTIX'), new Sell(TradeType.Amount, '100'), [new Buy('CFI', 'BCHYX', '100')] ),
new TacticalTrade( //12 trades new Filter('CORE', 'VIIIX'), new Sell(TradeType.Amount, '200'), [new Buy('EME', 'DFEMX', '50'), new Buy('EME', 'DFCEX', '50')] ),
new TacticalTrade( //3 trades new Filter('LCV', 'FEQIX'), new Sell(TradeType.PercentOfPosition, '4'), [new Buy('TIPS', 'FINPX', '80'), new Buy('EME', 'DFCEX', '20')] ), ]

case.title: Tactical Trader Attempt to sell security with no CurrentPrice

custom.steps: static trade7: TacticalTrade[] = [ new TacticalTrade( new Filter('', '381426NL5'), new Sell(TradeType.PercentOfPosition, '10'), [new Buy('EME', 'DFEMX', '100')] ) ]
custom.expected: Blotter should have the message [Cannot trade symbol because TRX does not have a current price.] for the security you attempted to sell.

case.title: Tactical Trader Create enough buys to cause paging on Tactical Trade Detail page

custom.steps:
Create 32 buys, which will result in 4 pages at 10/page. static trade15: TacticalTrade[] = [ new TacticalTrade( new Filter('CFI', 'ACBPX', ['9999-0023']), new Sell(TradeType.PercentOfPosition, '90'), [ new Buy('CORE', 'DFEOX', '2'), new Buy('TIPS', 'FINPX', '2'), new Buy('EME', 'DFEMX', '2'), new Buy('GE', 'AGGIX', '2'), new Buy('GFI', 'PEBIX', '2'), new Buy('GRE', 'DFREX', '2'), new Buy('INTLC', 'DFIEX', '2'), new Buy('LCV', 'ACIIX', '2'), new Buy('MC', 'VIMAX', '2'), new Buy('SHTIPS', 'APISX', '2'),
new Buy('COMM', 'DCMSX', '4'), new Buy('AAF1', 'PIRMX', '4'), new Buy('AAF1', 'PPRMX', '4'), new Buy('EME', 'DFCEX', '4'), new Buy('EME', 'DFESX', '4'), new Buy('GE', 'ACWI', '4'), new Buy('GE', 'TWGGX', '4'), new Buy('GE', 'VHGEX', '4'), new Buy('GFI', 'DIBRX', '4'), new Buy('SCV', 'DFSVX', '4'),
new Buy('GFI', 'PFOAX', '2'), new Buy('GFI', 'PFODX', '2'), new Buy('SCV', 'ANH', '2'), new Buy('GRE', 'PRETX', '2'), new Buy('GRE', 'TIAA RE', '2'), new Buy('SCV', 'ACVIX', '2'), new Buy('INTLC', 'DFALX', '2'), new Buy('INTLC', 'VANGINT', '2'), new Buy('INTLC', 'PYRINTL', '2'), new Buy('INTLSC', 'DFISX', '2'), new Buy('TIPS', 'AIANX', '10'), new Buy('TIPS', 'SEMPRA', '10'), ] ) ]

case.title: Cash setaside min 10K, max 15K, goal midpoint

custom.description: Go to Account 9999-0004. Change cash set-aside Min to $10,000 and cash set-aside Max to $15,000 and cash set-aside goal to midpoint. Do cash rebalance, verify.

case.title: Cash setaside min 10K, max 15K, goal maximum

custom.description: Go to Account 9999-0004. Change cash set-aside Min to $10,000 and cash set-aside Max to $15,000 and cash set-aside goal to maximum. Do cash rebalance, verify.

custom.steps: Attempt the following CGDA substitution: {distributingFund: 'ACIIX', dlt: '10', dst: '10', substituteFund: 'X', slt: '10', sst: '10'} The expected result is an alert will pop up with the message: Could not save CGDA. Substitute fund requested [<security>] cannot be used because it does not have a current price because the security X does not have a current price in the default database.
custom.expected: see Steps

custom.steps: Invoke the release notes from the Help menu and verify the contents of the modal

case.title: Reports: Review Proposed Trade History, group = trading

custom.steps:
Setup: restore DB from default.bak Create trade proposals Do an import from nothing.zip (expect error, but it moves trade proposals to history)
Client Management->Reports->Review Proposed Trade History, group=trading Input 1/1/1999 for From Trade Date Click View Report Download Excel file and compare to expected results

case.title: Single Client Rebalance. Switch model before rebalancing. Model of Models

custom.description:
Load default.bak DB default.bak is already loaded with two segments and a Model called "Balanced" which uses those segments
EquitySegment CORE 50 LCV 25 SCV 25
IncomeSegment CFI 50 EMFI 10 GFI 20 INTFI 20
Model of Models called balance which contains 50% each of the two segments above. Assign Balanced model to client 8202 Stark, William Do rebalance
